subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{cog|sit-pro|*ŋa-n||goose}}, cognate with {{cog|bo|ངང་པ}}, {{cog|my|ငန်း}}.

[[雁]] is either a derivative with {{w|Redundancy (linguistics)|redundant}} nominalizer *'''-n'''; or both {{och-l|鵝}} and {{och-l|雁}} reflect an earlier liquid final *'''-l''' or *'''-r''' ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). 

On resonants' correspondence among Burmese, Tibetan, and Chinese, see {{zh-ref|Hill (2014)}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
[[File:鹅肉.jpg|thumb|{{zh-l|鵝肉|gloss=goose meat}}]]
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{w|domestic goose}} (as opposed to a wild goose – {{zh-l|雁}})
# {{lb|zh|neologism}} a common [[civilian]] who suffers undue heavy [[tax]]

subSections.title: Compounds
Hanja
subSections.text:
{{ko-hanja|hangeul=아|eumhun=|rv=a|mr=a|y=a}}

# ([[거위]] 아, ''geowi-''): [[w:Domesticated goose|domesticated goose]] that would not fly at all, in contrast with the [[wild goose]] ([[雁]] ([[기러기]] 안, ''gireogi-an'')) whose [[skein]] flies in [[wedge]] or [[cuneiform]].
# ([[기러기]] 아, ''gireogi-''): [[wild goose]]
#* [[기러기|그려기]] [[오리|올히]]는 [[길다|기리]] [[헤아리다|헤요미]] [[마땅하다|맛당하니]] : 鵝鴨宜長數 <杜詩諺解, 1481, 7:9> <ref>남광우 교학고어사전, 서울, 1997, p. 169.</ref>

subSections.title: Synonyms
subSections.text:
* {{l|ko|鴻}} ([[큰]] [[기러기]] 홍, ''keun-gireogi-hong'') big [[greylag goose]]
* {{l|ko|雁}} ([[기러기]] 안, ''gireogi-an'') [[wild goose]], [[greylag goose]]
* {{l|ko|家雁}} ([[가안]], ''ga-an'') ''literally'', domestic or house goose
